Text: ENS ST Rotor Claim Draft Form of Acceptance Cc email Ed Based on the message below from Alf I assume HeathLambert has been assisting you with this and agrees with your approach If they agree I think your approach in completing this is appropriate Good work Paul From Cattigan Ed Sent Monday November AM To Astramowicz Jarek Overfield Adam Forycki Krzysztof Edgley Anne Wantschek Lloyd Derrick Jr James Cc Glowacki Jacek Martin Sophie Hackett Christian Willott Carys Muscroft Brian Parrish Paul E Subject FW ENS Draft Form of Acceptance Good Afternoon Attached are documents in relation to final Settlement of the outstanding Delay in Start up relating to the replacement of the previously damaged rotor claim One is a detailed history of the claim and the other a final acceptance notice proposed by the brokers I have been negotiating the outstanding portion of the claim now for nearly months and believe that due to the circumstance surrounding the late delivery of the rotor and the advice of external council this settlement is acceptable to ENS Will you please advise wether you agree with accepting this sum as full and final settlement In way of context this settlement is k of a possible k an success on a claim we had been advised would not have been worth taking to arbitration if the insurers had become difficult regards Ed Sophie Could you please confirm that you are happy with the wording of the acceptance notice NOTE I would really like to complete this by Wednesday this week as this is my last week Original Message From BODIMEADE Alfred mailto Sent November To Ed Cattigan Subject FW ENS Draft Form of Acceptance Ed Let me know asap if you have any problem I think the figures are correct Alf

Redline of Electronic Copy of Interconnection Operation Agreement with commentsGreg I have a couple of comments on Article Insurance It appears that most of my changes were entered but I see a couple of modifications still needed is titled Customers Insurance but the paragraph below it discuss each Party so this needs to be changed so the title refers to the list of insurance requirements below and the title refers to the whole article in the fifth line delete coverage coverage for and in the sixth line delete and in the third line delete of in the third line a space is needed between policies and are I believe that is all that is needed Please let me know what FPLs response is Paul Original Message From Krause Greg Sent Thursday July PM To Jacoby Ben Grube Raimund Nicolay Christi Mann Kay Scott Susan Rose Steven Soderquist Larry Parrish Paul E Subject RE Redline of Electronic Copy of Interconnection Operation Agreement with comments Please find attached the Midway IA redlined to show the differences between the generic and the project specific draft and also showing the comments Ive collected to date Please note that the comments were added by changing the font and format rather than by using the trackhighlight changes function As you know we had scheduled a call with FPL for tomorrow Since we have not sent FPL our comments I suggested to Tom Sanders of FPL that we postpone the call until Monday This is assuming we get them our comments to them tomorrow If that is not possible we may need to push the call back further hope that redlining and consolidating the comments will help with your review Please provide me with any additional comments at your earliest convenience File FPL MDC IO Agmt redline with commentsdoc
